title: I loved these until...
content: Let‚Äôs get back on track,I‚Äôve purchased this set in August of 2023 and HAVE used it quite a bit. Durability, efficiency, reliability and quality. The set is very affordable for those who are looking to invest into ‚Äúdecent‚Äù pots and not break the bank. For those who care to match it to your kitchen,then yes,it IS very estatic and doesn‚Äôt make you hate your life every time you throw spaghetti in it. I can‚Äôt say that I‚Äôve used it ‚Äúproperly‚Äù 100%,there‚Äôs been a few times where I‚Äôve used a fork to turn a pancake over and OH MY GOSH of course I scratched the surface. Which is‚Ä¶.okay. Because it‚Äôs not meant to be used with metal forks and spoons and  the packaging says so,so I am not taking any points off for that. The handles are very sturdy and even though,6 months later I am still feeling uneasy to pick it up just by the handle alone if it‚Äôs full of boiling water thinking it will somehow unclip and burn my so many times sunburnt legs again‚Ä¶it never happened and yes I have carried a full pot of boiling water ACROSS my kitchen and waltzed back with it to the stove. Bottom line-the handles are GOOD and reliable. They are extremely easy to clean,by hand or dishwasher,so why 4 stars you might wonder‚Ä¶Ahhhhh,well‚Ä¶they ARE easy to clean INSIDE‚Ä¶BUT,the bottom of the pans for some weird reason have this black grease on it that wouldn‚Äôt come off for the life of me and oh I tried to get it off! BELIEVE me I‚Äôve tried! For those who made it this far,pictures would perfectly relay to you what exactly I mean by black grease,or whatever that stuff is..scrub it,wash it,nothing gets rid of it. Is it a dealbreaker??No,not for me,but it‚Äôs nice to let y'all know in case you‚Äôve experienced that before with other cookware and have this in your cart already :) Overall,decent set and quality matches the price.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2024

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Set aside the fact that they don‚Äôt seem to cook very evenly. (I have a gas range and it tends to heat pans up pretty evenly.) Using them to saut√© anything, even if you use an oil to lubricate, leads to permanent discoloration of the pan. For some reason, the underside keep emitting black substance that gets on the top of the other pans if you stack them. you can keep scrubbing them, I even took a magic eraser to them, but the black stuff will keep on coming.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2024

title: Beautiful and space saving but‚Ä¶
content: Lastly, you would think that the handles, which are very innovative in their design, would have some sort of heatproof cover on them. Unfortunately, they don‚Äôt. I learned this firsthand when I was smelling a burning smell while cooking and knew the food was doing just fine and realized that the handle had caught fire and was slowly smoking. It was mostly the rubber pad that squishes up against the pan, but also it affected the faux metal material, that was nearby. The pan was resting evenly on the burner and I don't feel like the flame was too high. One of the handles also no longer closes firmly enough, and sometimes if the pan is too heavy, the handle will disengage when you lift it. I almost lost a pot of boiling water that way. I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm just really hard on my pans, I mostly use a cast-iron as my tried and true and I‚Äôve had it for over 20 years. But I would never buy these again, and if they offered me replacements, I would say no thank you. I wish I could get a refund to put toward a new set of pots and pans that are space saving but I know too much time has passed. Definitely a financial loss here, I would stay away.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I do love my new pots and pan set. They are a beautiful set and I love that you can stack them upon each other to save space. I agree with the durability of the coating from some of the other reviews. I have a few chips in my set already. And some discoloration on one of the pans I use more often. (Just some background info, I cook everyday and have had my set since Nov, using them since Dec). Also, I may have received some defective handles because after a month or so they became super loose and wobbly- see my video clip- and made it very unsafe for even a short transfer from my stove to sink and back. The customer service at Carote was so helpful and responsive. I sent them the info they requested and they ended up sending me 2 new handles that are snug and secure now. Overall happy with my purchase! May want to try their set with the attached handles next time I need a new set.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024

title: Make the purchase!
content: I am so glad I bought this 12 piece set. I have a what I consider a small kitchen, with limited storage. I can separate out the set into bowl shaped and flat shaped. I can use each pot with pot holders only, or use both handles on one pot. There are only two lids that fit all the sizes. I can remove a handle for better moisture and heat retention with the lid on. The handles can be put on hooks. I have magnetic hooks on the hood above the stove and store my cooking utensils on the hooks. And the pots and pans can be cleaned in a dishwasher! My previous set of standards pots and pans will be donated. Yahoo!

title: Quick to tarnish! Handles Melting!!
content: A grilled cheese sandwich permanently burnt into the smallest pan during the very first use. I wanted to contact customer service. However, the Amazon link to support goes to a 404 error website. One of the handles also discolored from the heat I wouldn‚Äôt suggest buying these, no matter how cute they are. I will most likely be buying a better set in the next few months.

title: Verified Purchase
content: The handle isn't that resistive to heat. And I already have scratches in most pans. With a reddish dicolorings in the pan with one warped. Just don't use on gas stoves or high temps I guess.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
